item.title: Nationalism in India
item.description: Warning THIS ARTICLE IS INCOMPLETE Introduction This chapter will take a look at India from the 1920s and ahead, with emphasis on the Non-Cooperation and Civil Disobedience movements. In India as well as many other ex-colonies, the growth of modern nationalism is intimately connected with the anti-colonial movement. Oppression under colonialism forged a shared bond that tied many different groups together. Even then, each class and group felt the effects of colonialism differently, therefore their notions of freedom were not the same.
